name: BBCWorld
text:
Violence erupted in US cities on the sixth night of protests sparked by the death of George Floyd in police custody

THREAD ‚¨áÔ∏è

Live updates: https://t.co/6X4FCN3eMx https://t.co/AcrbJCzhV6

name: BBCWorld
text:
About 16,000 National Guard troops in 24 states and Washington, DC have been deployed to deal with the unrest 

Live updates: https://t.co/6X4FCN3eMx https://t.co/weu90cvFtu

name: BBCWorld
text:
Most of the protests began peacefully - and several stayed peaceful

But in some areas, demonstrators clashed with police, set police cars on fire, vandalised property and looted shops
https://t.co/12Frx89Mzt

name: BBCWorld
text:
Demonstrators set fire to properties near the White House, including a historic church 

President Trump was reportedly taken to a bunker beneath the White House

Live updates: https://t.co/6X4FCN3eMx https://t.co/ME7R6E9dIV

name: BBCWorld
text:
At least 4,400 people have been arrested in several days of protests, according to the Associated Press

Curfews have been imposed in multiple cities across the US

Live updates: https://t.co/6X4FCN3eMx https://t.co/JQQDynESRZ

name: BBCWorld
text:
Dozens of journalists covering the protests have reported being targeted using tear gas, rubber bullets and pepper spray

Read more:
https://t.co/Rtogje7Mi9

name: BBCWorld
text:
Some videos and photos being shared from the protests aren't what they claim to be

The BBC's anti-disinformation team has been tracking misleading videos and conspiracy theories spreading on social media
https://t.co/NKIw5ZLPwe

name: BBCWorld
text:
